item.title: Puzzle: Triangle in a Square Defined by Arcs
item.description: Question Solving it using GeoGebra Area of the triange is $$0.04 x^2$$ where $$x$$ is the length of the side of the square. Solving it without GeoGebra Let the Quarter Circle ACD be $$C_1$$ Let the Semi Circle with Diameter along AB be $$C_2$$ Let the Semi Circle with Diameter along BC be $$C_3$$ $$ C_1: x^2 + y^2 = 1 $$ $$ C_2: (x-0.5)^2 + (y-1)^2 = 0.25 $$
